questions.question: A wave has a frequency of 5 Hz. What is its period?
questions.explanation: Period (T) = 1 / Frequency (f) = 1 / 5 Hz = 0.2 seconds.

questions.question: If a wave completes 40 cycles in 8 seconds, what is its frequency?
questions.explanation: Frequency (f) = Number of cycles / Time = 40 / 8 s = 5 Hz.

questions.question: A wave travels at 340 m/s with a wavelength of 0.5 m. What is its frequency?
questions.explanation: v = fλ, so f = v / λ = 340 m/s / 0.5 m = 680 Hz.

questions.question: What is the speed of a wave with a period of 0.02 s and a wavelength of 4 m?
questions.explanation: First find frequency: f = 1/T = 1/0.02 s = 50 Hz. Then v = fλ = 50 Hz × 4 m = 200 m/s.

questions.question: A wave has a frequency of 1000 Hz and a speed of 1500 m/s. What is its wavelength?
If the period of a wave is 0.1 seconds, how many cycles will occur in 2 minutes?
questions.explanation: Frequency f = 1/T = 1/0.1 s = 10 Hz (10 cycles per second). In 2 minutes (120 seconds): Cycles = f × time = 10 Hz × 120 s = 1200 cycles.

questions.question: A wave with wavelength 2.5 m travels at 500 m/s. What is its period?
questions.explanation: First find frequency: f = v/λ = 500 m/s / 2.5 m = 200 Hz. Then T = 1/f = 1/200 Hz = 0.005 s.

questions.question: What is the wavelength of a 440 Hz sound wave traveling at 340 m/s?
A wave oscillates with a period of 0.04 s. What is its frequency?
If 300 waves pass a point in 60 seconds, what is the frequency?
questions.explanation: f = Number of waves / Time = 300 / 60 s = 5 Hz.

questions.question: A wave travels 600 meters in 2 seconds. What is its speed?
questions.explanation: Speed = Distance / Time = 600 m / 2 s = 300 m/s.

questions.question: What is the period of a wave that has a frequency of 250 Hz?
A wave with frequency 85 Hz has a wavelength of 4 m. Calculate its speed.
questions.explanation: v = fλ = 85 Hz × 4 m = 340 m/s.

questions.question: How long does it take for 150 cycles of a 30 Hz wave to occur?
questions.explanation: Time = Number of cycles / Frequency = 150 / 30 Hz = 5 seconds.

questions.question: A wave moving at 1200 m/s has a period of 0.001 s. What is its wavelength?
questions.explanation: First find frequency: f = 1/T = 1/0.001 s = 1000 Hz. Then λ = v/f = 1200 m/s / 1000 Hz = 1.2 m.

questions.question: If a wave's speed is 150 m/s and its wavelength is 0.3 m, what is its period?
questions.explanation: First find frequency: f = v/λ = 150 m/s / 0.3 m = 500 Hz. Then T = 1/f = 1/500 Hz = 0.002 s.

questions.question: What frequency has a period of 0.0005 seconds?
A wave travels 2.5 km in 5 seconds. What is its speed in m/s?
questions.explanation: Distance = 2.5 km = 2500 m. Speed = Distance / Time = 2500 m / 5 s = 500 m/s.

questions.question: How many complete cycles occur in 0.1 seconds for a wave of frequency 2500 Hz?
questions.explanation: Number of cycles = f × time = 2500 Hz × 0.1 s = 250 cycles.

questions.question: A wave has a wavelength of 8 m and a period of 0.4 s. What is its speed?
questions.explanation: First find frequency: f = 1/T = 1/0.4 s = 2.5 Hz. Then v = fλ = 2.5 Hz × 8 m = 20 m/s.

scoreMessages.70: Good work! You understand the relationships. Watch out for unit conversions and formula rearrangement.
scoreMessages.50: You're getting the basics. Focus on practicing the three formulas: v=fλ, f=1/T, and T=1/f.
